content.body: bakkot: I thought that when you detached a view its [[ByteLength]] would be 0?
content.formatted_body: bakkot: I thought that when you detached a view its [[ByteLength]] would be 0?

content.body: annevk: you detach buffers, not views
detaching a buffer does indeed set its [[ArrayBufferByteLength]] to 0 but it doesn't reach out and also update the views of that buffer
bakkot: it seems implementations treat it as 0 so I guess we some kind of length getter that accounts for detachment
content.formatted_body: bakkot: it seems implementations treat it as 0 so I guess we some kind of length getter that accounts for detachment

content.body: zcorpan: Can you help me understand https://github.com/web-platform-tests/wpt/blob/master/css/css-ui/compute-kind-widget-generated/kind-of-widget-fallback-checkbox-input-background-attachment-001.html and friends? If you disable the auto appearance, wouldn't you get appearance:none? But that's not what's expected.

If you disable the auto appearance, wouldn't you get appearance:none? But that's not what's expected.

content.body: annevk: sure. The test is correct, but the title is misleading/incorrect.
content.formatted_body: annevk: sure. The test is correct, but the title is misleading/incorrect.

content.body: annevk: looks like the build script doesn't know what the pass condition should be, it's only in the reference. I can make the title not say what is expected
content.formatted_body: annevk: looks like the build script doesn't know what the pass condition should be, it's only in the reference. I can make the title not say what is expected
